00043 class KGLEngine;
00044 class VirtualButton;

00046 class VirtualButton // create a virtal button : example VirtalButton("JUMP", KEY_UP, keyboard);
00047 {
00048 public:
00049     VirtualButton(QString id=0, int keyCode=0, KCLInput *device=NULL);
00050     QString id(){return m_id;}
00051     int code(){return m_keyCode;}
00052     KCLInput * input(){return m_device;}
00053 
00054 private:
00055     QString m_id;
00056     int m_keyCode;
00057     KCLInput * m_device;
00058 
00059 
00060 };

00064 class KCLEngine : public QObject
00065 {
00066     Q_OBJECT
00067 
00068 public:
00069 
00070     KCLEngine(QObject * parent = 0);
00071     void addInput(KCLInput * input);
00072     void addInput(const QString &deviceName);
00073     void addInput(DEVICE device, int id=0);
00074     void remInput(KCLInput * input){m_inputList.removeOne(input);}
00075     void remInput(DEVICE device, int id=0);
00076     KCLInput * input(int id=0){return m_inputList.at(id);}
00077 
00078     void setButton(QString name,int code, KCLInput * input);
00079 
00080     void remAll();
00081 
00082     void searchDevice();
00083     bool button(QString name);
00084     bool anyPress();
00085     bool anyMove();
00086 
00087     QStringList deviceList(DEVICE device)
00088     {
00089         QStringList list;
00090         QMapIterator<QString, DEVICE> i(m_devicesType);
00091         while (i.hasNext()) {
00092             i.next();
00093             if ( i.value() == device)
00094                 list<<i.key();
00095         }
00096         return list;
00097     }
00098 
00099 private:
00100     QList<KCLInput*> m_inputList; //active device . Use add and rem to manage it
00101     QMap <QString,DEVICE> m_devicesType;
00102     QMap <QString, VirtualButton> m_virtalButtonMap; // set Virtual Button
00103 
00104 
00105 };
